meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an oligopoly.
meanings.sent1: The oligopolistic market was dominated by a few big companies.
meanings.sent2: The industry showed oligopolistic tendencies with only a handful of major players.
meanings.sent3: In the oligopolistic world of soda, the battle between Coke and Pepsi raged on.
meanings.sent4: The oligopolistic control of the diamond market made it difficult for new companies to enter.
meanings.sent5: The oligopolistic nature of the smartphone industry led to fierce competition among a select few.

meanings.sent1: Her oligopolistic behavior mirrored that of the dominant companies in the market.
meanings.sent2: The oligopolistic structure of the industry limited competition and innovation.
meanings.sent3: The siblings' oligopolistic control over the lemonade stand left no room for other sellers.
meanings.sent4: The oligopolistic grip on the music streaming services stifled diversity in the market.
meanings.sent5: The oligopolistic pricing strategies kept prices high and choices limited for consumers.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an oligopoly.
meanings.sent1: The oligopolistic agreement among the companies raised concerns about fair competition.
meanings.sent2: His proposal aimed to regulate oligopolistic practices in the telecommunications sector.
meanings.sent3: The oligopolistic alliance between the two tech giants surprised many industry analysts.
meanings.sent4: The oligopolistic nature of the airline industry led to price-fixing scandals.
meanings.sent5: The oligopolistic control over the oil market influenced global prices significantly.
